superseding_details.component_description: 166463FUL was granted three years after the scheme was complete so  completion date left on PP/2013/5667 and later permission superseded to avoid double counting of completed units

protected_spaces_details.description: Allotments, community gardens and city farms

description: Redevelopment to provide a two-storey building comprising of four x two storey residential house with associated refuse area and communal amenity space following demolition of existing commercial/storage units
decision_conditions: Time Limit (Full Permission)  The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.    Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | Approved Drawings  The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: Ref 538/00A, /01, /02J, /03I, /04G, /05H, /06, /07A, & /08A. Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning to ensure that the  development is implemented in accordance with the approved plans, which have been,  assessed against the Council's Adopted Development Plan. | Samples of Materials  Details (and samples where appropriate) of the materials to be used for the exterior surfaces of the building shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local  Planning Authority before the development is commenced, and this condition shall  apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this  application. The development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details.   Reason: To ensure that the materials are of appropriate quality and harmonise with surrounding developments and to safeguard the character and appearance of the conservation area in accordance with policies 3.5, 7.4, 7.6 and 7.8 of the London Plan (2011), and Ealing Local Variation policy 7.4 of Ealing's Development Management DPD (December 2013). | Details of Hard and Soft Landscaping & Boundary Treatment  No development shall take place until full details of both hard and soft landscape works, including a phased programme of works, details of boundary treatment and details of landscape management for a minimum period of 5 years from the implementation of final planting have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. These works shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupation of any part of the development or in accordance with the programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority.  Any trees or other plants which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season.   Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped and enclosed in the interests of the character and appearance of the area; the amenity of neighbouring occupiers and in the interests of crime prevention, in accordance with policies 7.3, 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2011) and policies 7A, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | Refuse & Cycle Storage  Prior to the first occupation of any of the dwellings hereby approved, the refuse and recycling store and cycle storage shall be provided in accordance with the details shown on the approved drawings and shall be retained thereafter for the life of the development.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of existing and future occupiers of the area and to safeguard the appearance of the area, in accordance with policies 6.13 and 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 4 'Refuse Storage'. | Removal of Permitted Development Rights (Classes A to F):  Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A, B, C, D, E and F of Schedule 2, Part 1 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (or any other order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification) no extensions, alterations or other works shall be carried out without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.  Reason: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties and the appearance of the area, in accordance with policy 7.6 of the London Plan (2011), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and policies 7A and & 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | Arboricultural Method Statement  No operations (including initial site clearance) shall commence on site in connection with development hereby approved until a suitable scheme (Arboricultural Method Statement) for the protection of the Acer tree adjacent has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. All protection measures must fully detail each phase of the development process taking into account demolition/site clearance works, and all construction works. Details shall include the following:    a.Full survey of the tree in accordance with BS5837 (using the most recent                 revision of the standard), with tree works proposals.  The tree must be plotted                 on a site plan (minimum scale 1:200), clearly and accurately depicting trunk                 location, root protection area and canopy spread; b. Soil assessment/survey and soil remediation plans; c. Timing and phasing of any tree works; d. Site specific demolition and hard surface removal specifications;  e. Site specific construction specifications;  f. A Tree protection plan (minimum scale of 1:200) in accordance with BS5837 (most recent revision of the standard) detailing all methods of protection, including but not restricted to: location of construction exclusion zones, root protection area, fit for purpose fencing and ground protection, service routes, works access space, material/machinery/waste storage and permanent & temporary hard surfaces.     All tree protection methods detailed in the approved Arboricultural Method Statement shall not be moved or removed, temporarily or otherwise, until all works including external works have been completed and all equipment, machinery and surplus materials have been removed from the  site, unless the prior approval of the Local Planning Authority has first been sought and obtained.   Reason: To secure the protection, throughout the time that the development is being carried out, of the tree growing adjacent to the site which is of amenity value to the area in accordance with policy 7.6 of the London Plan (2011), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), and policies 5.10 and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), and Supplementary Planning Guidance 9 'Trees and Development Guidance'. | Obscure glazing   The first floor windows in the north elevation of each of the four dwellings hereby approved shall be fixed shut and fitted with obscure glass prior to the first occupation of any of the dwellings and permanently retained for the life of the development.   Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of neighbouring dwellings to the north, in accordance with policies 7A and & 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | Sustainability Condition - Code for Sustainable Homes   Each of the 4 dwellings hereby permitted shall be constructed to achieve a minimum Code for Sustainable Homes Level 4 or higher as required by the approved development plan standard at that time. Within three months of the commencement of the development, evidence that the development is registered with the Building Research Establishment (BRE) (or similar approved body) under the Code for Sustainable Homes and an Interim Code for Sustainable Homes Assessment and Certificate shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval. No residential dwelling shall be occupied in the development until a Post-Construction Code for Sustainable Homes Assessment and Certificate verified by the BRE (or similar approved body) has been submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval confirming that the agreed sustainability measures have been achieved. Such measures shall be retained for the life of the development.  Reason: To ensure a sustainable living environment is secured in accordance with policies 3.5, 5.1, 5.2, 5.3, 5.5, 5.6, 5.7 and 5.9 of the London Plan (2011) and policies 1.1 (k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and policy 5.2 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | Construction Method Statement  Prior to the commencement of development, and prior to demolition of the existing buildings on the site, a Construction Management Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The plan shall include the following:  a. Construction traffic management proposals including details of delivery routes and HGV movements and details of any temporary site access/parking; b. Details of construction hours; c. Noise mitigation and monitoring measures; d. Details of enclosure of working areas and the location of compounds for the storage of plant and materials; e. Details of temporary lighting; f. Dust suppression and monitoring measures, having regard to BRE guide 'Control of Dust from Construction and Demolition Activities'; g. Wheel wash measures; h. Site security during construction; i. A drainage strategy to operate setting out controls of contamination, including j. controls to surface water run-off, water pumping, storage of fuels and hazardous materials, spill response plans and pollution control measures; and k. Procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents.  The Construction Management Plan shall be implemented on commencement of any works on site and the site shall be managed in accordance with the approved plan for the duration of demolition and construction, or as otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact during the course of the works, in accordance with policies 5.14 and 5.15 of the London Plan (2011), policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), and policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), and | Noise - Insulation of building envelopes  Prior to the commencement of the development, details in line with the criteria specified in SPG10 shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, including, as appropriate, the noise exposure category, the BS4142 rating noise and the predicted vibration levels. The details shall also include the noise mitigation measures with windows closed and other means of ventilation provided and also mitigation of vibration. Such details as approved shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of any residential units and thereafter permanently retained.  Reason: To ensure that adequate off-street parking and disabled parking is retained to serve the proposed development and in the interests of pedestrian and highway safety, in  accordance with policies 3.5, 6.11, 6.13, 7.2, and 7.3 of the London Plan 2011,and Ealing Local Variation policies 3.5 and 6.13 of Ealing's Development Management DPD (December 2013). | External lighting  Details of any new external lighting to be erected on the site shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority This shall include details of the luminance of any new external lighting proposed. The proposed external lighting scheme shall be designed to reduce light pollution to nearby residents, and road users and where applicable the recommendations of the following guidance shall be met:  a. ILP Guidance Notes for the reduction of Obtrusive Lighting 2011. b. Institution of Lighting Professionals Technical Report No 5, Brightness of Illuminated Advertisements c. CIE Technical Report- Guide on the Limitation of the Effects of Obtrusive Light from Outdoor Lighting Installations - CIE 150: 2003. d. Statutory Nuisance from Insects and Artificial Light by Department of Environment Food.  Reason: To protect the working and living conditions of occupiers in the locality in accordance with policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2011), policy 1.1 j, of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), and policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | Land Contamination  1) Site Characterisation - No development shall take place until an investigation and risk assessment is completed in accordance with a scheme to assess the nature and extent of any contamination of the site, and has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning authority. This assessment must be undertaken by a competent person, and shall assess any contamination on the site, whether or not it originates on the site. the report of the findings must include:  (i)	A survey of the extent, scale and nature of contamination;  (ii)	An assessment of the potential risks to:  1.1 Human health, 1.2 Property (existing or proposed) including buildings, crops, livestock, pets, woodland and service lines and pipes, 1.3 Adjoining land, 1.4 Groundwater and surface waters, 1.5 Ecological systems, 1.6 Archaeological sites and ancient monuments;   (iii)	An appraisal of remedial options, and proposal of the preferred option(s). This must be conducted in accordance with DEFRA and the Environment Agency`s `Model Procedures for the Management of Land Contamination, CLR 11`.  2) Submission of Remediation Scheme - No development shall take place until a detailed remediation scheme to bring the site to a condition suitable for the intended use is submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The scheme must include all works to be undertaken, proposed remediation objectives and remediation criteria, timetable of works and site management procedures. The scheme must ensure that the site will not qualify as contaminated land under Part 2A of the Environmental Protection Act 1990 in relation to the intended use of the land after remediation.  3) Implementation of Approved Remediation Scheme - The approved remediation scheme must be carried out in accordance with its terms prior to the commencement of development other than that required to carry out remediation, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The Local Planning Authority must be given two weeks notification of commencement of the remediation scheme works.  4) Verification - Following completion of measures identified in the approved remediation scheme, a verification report that demonstrates the effectiveness of the remediation carried out must be produced, and is subject to the approval in writing of the Local planning authority.  The verification report submitted shall be in accordance with Environment Agency guidance `Verification of Remediation of Land Contamination`, report SC030114/R1.   Reason: To protect the health and living conditions of residents in accordance with policy 5.13 of the London Plan (2011), policy 1.1 of the Ealing  the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012). | Air Quality   Prior to the commencement of the development, the applicant shall submit to the Local Planning Authority for written approval a scheme for providing fresh air ventilation to habitable rooms both the South Ealing Road and car park facades, the supply to be provided form the front of the building at high level. The approved mitigation scheme shall be implemented in its entirety before any of the units are occupied.  Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of residents in accordance with policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2011), policy1.1 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), polices 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | Building Emissions  Prior to the commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, for the installation in each dwelling of an Ultra-Low NOx boiler with maximum NOx Emissions of under 40 mg/kWh. The works, as approved, shall be completed prior to occupation and thereafter permanently retained.   Reason: To minimise the impact of building emissions on local air quality in accordance with London Plan Policy 7.14, policy1.1 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), polices 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013).
